page.title: 12HUMSHAUGH RELIGION
page.content:
ST. PETER'S, A{CHURCH OF ENGLAND,}WAS BUILT IN 1818 AND HAS AN ADJOINING VICARAGE. THE PRESENT INCUMBENT, THE RURAL DEAN OF BELLINGHAM, WAS RECENTLY GIVEN CHARGE OF THE ANGLICAN PARISHES OF SIMONBURN AND WARK WHICH HAVE AMALGAMTED WITH HUMSHAUGH AND SERVICES ARE HELD IN THE THREE CHURCHES EVERY SUNDAY.
THERE IS ALSO A{METHODIST CHURCH}BUILT IN 1962, EXTENDED IN 1879, WITH A SUNDAY SCHOOL BUILDING ERECTED IN 1904 AND NOW USED AS A HALL.
MEMBERS OF THE{ROMAN CATHOLIC}CHURCH AND OF OTHER PROTESTANT FAITHS GO TO HEXHAM OR ELSEWHERE FOR CHURCH SERVICES.
